summary: This bill, the Duplications of Benefits Victims Relief Act, amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to allow the President to waive prohibitions on the duplication of benefits for individuals and entities affected by major disasters or emergencies. It outlines conditions for such waivers, including the public interest and consideration of FEMA recommendations. The bill also mandates a report from FEMA to improve disaster assistance delivery, addressing coordination, clarity, and communication across federal agencies. The bill applies to disasters and emergencies declared on or after January 1, 2016.
